Construct a SQL CTE Clause for Scope Materials

Source: R/data-access_int.R
dot-da_matl_scope_cte_get.Rd

Internal helper function that generates a Common Table Expression (CTE) SQL snippet for scope materials. If .scope_matl is TRUE, the function constructs the CTE SQL snippet using the .da_matl_scope_get function. If .scope_matl is FALSE, an empty string is returned.

Usage

.da_matl_scope_cte_get(.scope_matl, .con)

Arguments

.scope_matl

Logical. Determines whether the scope materials CTE should be included in the query. If TRUE, the function constructs the SQL snippet.

.con

A database connection object. Required for safely constructing the SQL snippet using glue::glue_sql.

Value

A character string containing the SQL snippet for the scope materials CTE if .scope_matl is TRUE. Returns an empty string otherwise.

Details

This function relies on the .da_matl_scope_get function to dynamically generate the SQL snippet for the scope materials CTE. The snippet is constructed using glue::glue_sql for safe parameterization of inputs. If the .scope_matl parameter is FALSE, the function avoids constructing the CTE and instead returns an empty string.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Example usage
cte_sql <- .da_matl_scope_cte_get(
  .scope_matl = TRUE,
  .con = my_db_connection
)
print(cte_sql)
} # }
